sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 4, 6}. Find the Cartesian product of A and B, then find the symmetric difference between A and B using the Cartesian product. Show that the symmetric difference of A and B is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product by comparing (A △ B) x (B △ A) and (B △ A) x (A △ B).
